implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Defines the REST endpoint '/tasks' for adding a new task. Receives a TaskCreate object with all required fields (title, description, priority, due_date, user_name) and delegates creation to the service layer.
implementation.name: create_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
On POST /tasks with TaskCreate payload:
    TRY
        Call task_service.create_task(task)
        RETURN created Task
    EXCEPT Exception as e
        Raise HTTP 400 with error message

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Implements business logic for creating a task. Logs the operation and passes the TaskCreate data (including all required fields) to the repository.
implementation.name: TaskService.create_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
Function create_task(task_data):
    Log 'Creating task for user: task_data.user_name'
    RETURN repository.add_task(task_data)

implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles persistence of the new task. Creates a Task object with all required fields, assigns a unique ID, stores it, and returns the Task.
implementation.name: TaskRepository.add_task
implementation.pseudo_code:
Function add_task(task_data):
    Create Task with id = _id_counter and fields from task_data
    Append Task to _tasks list
    Increment _id_counter
    Log 'Task created: task'
    RETURN Task
